meanings.definition: A person who is dissatisfied and rebellious.
meanings.sent1: The malcontent in the group always complained about the rules.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to deal with a malcontent student who refused to follow instructions.
meanings.sent3: The malcontent's constant grumbling made everyone roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: Her rebellious spirit marked her as a malcontent in the eyes of the authorities.
meanings.sent5: The malcontent's dissatisfaction fueled their desire for change.

meanings.sent1: She malcontents whenever she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: The workers began to malcontent against the unfair treatment.
meanings.sent3: He malcontents about the smallest inconveniences.
meanings.sent4: Their refusal to follow the rules showed they were ready to malcontent.
meanings.sent5: The group decided to malcontent until their demands were met.

meanings.sent1: The malcontent speech riled up the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The malcontent policies led to widespread protests.
meanings.sent3: The malcontent cat knocked over the vase in protest of the new furniture.
meanings.sent4: The malcontent atmosphere in the office made everyone on edge.
meanings.sent5: The malcontent music stirred up feelings of unrest in the audience.
